1117310.1134/11173.1608-3318Russian Journal of Coordination ChemistryRuss J Coord Chem1070-32841608-3318Pleiades PublishingMoscowS107032841803003X17210.1134/S107032841803003XArticleSynthesis, Characterization, and Properties of a 1D Zinc(II) Complex from Substituted Imidazole DicarboxylateLinX. S.1SangY. L.1bgrid.443353.6College of Chemistry and Chemical EngineeringChifeng University024000Chifeng, NeimengguP.R. Chinasangyali0814@126.com133201832018443207213123201827620171332018© Pleiades Publishing, Ltd. 20182018Abstract

A one-dimensional zinc(II) polymer, {[Zn2((p-FPhHIDC)(p-FPhH2IDC)2)(Phen)2] · H2O}n (I) (p-FPhH3IDC = 2-(p-fluorophenyl)-1H-imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylicacid (Phen = 1,10-phenanthroline), has been solvothermally synthesized and structurally characterized by single-crystal X-ray diffraction (CIF file CCDC no. 1063532), elemental analyses, and IR spectra. In polymer I, these 1D wave chains were joined through the π–π interactions and intermolecular hydrogen bonds to give a 2D architecture. The thermal properties of I have been determined in air.

elements.content: A one-dimensional zinc(II) polymer, {[Zn2((p-FPhHIDC)(p-FPhH2IDC)2)(Phen)2] · H2O}n (I) (p-FPhH3IDC = 2-(p-fluorophenyl)-1H-imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylicacid (Phen = 1,10-phenanthroline), has been solvothermally synthesized and structurally characterized by single-crystal X-ray diffraction (CIF file CCDC no. 1063532), elemental analyses, and IR spectra. In polymer I, these 1D wave chains were joined through the π–π interactions and intermolecular hydrogen bonds to give a 2D architecture. The thermal properties of I have been determined in air.
elements.clean_text:
Abstract

A one-dimensional zinc(II) polymer, {[Zn2((p-FPhHIDC)(p-FPhH2IDC)2)(Phen)2] ⋅ H2O}n (I) (p-FPhH3IDC = 2-(p-fluorophenyl)-1H-imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylicacid (Phen = 1,10-phenanthroline), has been solvothermally synthesized and structurally characterized by single-crystal X-ray diffraction (CIF file CCDC no. 1063532), elemental analyses, and IR spectra. In polymer I, these 1D wave chains were joined through the π-π interactions and intermolecular hydrogen bonds to give a 2D architecture. The thermal properties of I have been determined in air.
